issue.title: Work in progress: node-fetch v2

repository.name: node-fetch
repository.description: A light-weight module that brings the Fetch API to Node.js

issue.body:
## DO NOT MERGE

This PR will be continuously updated as more updates roll in. Feel free to initiate pull requests against this branch to help with this process.
## Work needed to be done
- [x] Use Babel
- [x] Add iterator interface to Headers #174
- [x] Convert all files to modern JavaScript syntax
- Split and merge #140 
  - ~~WHATWG streams support~~
  - [x] Text encoding conversion #184 #188
  - [ ] Determine behavior of `.blob()` 
- [x] Resolve Headers incompatibility #181 #185
- [ ] Implement a few missing methods such as `Response.error` and `Response.redirect`
- [x] Fix spec compliance for objects as URL #175 #187
## Discussion
- **Code style:** it seems to be preferred that spaces are used instead of tabs for most people (myself included), so should we use that instead? **No.**

body:
Option 4 would be convenient for developers, but I do wonder if we should keep the API out of Response Class, could it be Fetch.toUTF8?

(I remember myself asking about it on whatwg github and they offer a simple workaround to me.)

From my phone,
David

> 在 2016年10月11日，04:22，Timothy Gu notifications@github.com 写道：
> 
> Originally reported by @gwicke in gwicke/node-fetch-polyfill#1.
> 
> Currently, node-fetch attempts to automatically detect the encoding of the input source, and convert it to UTF-8. However, the Fetch Standard says that only a plain UTF-8 decode should be performed, regardless of the actual input encoding. As written in the referenced issue and confirmed by myself, the spec behavior is what's implemented by the browsers.
> 
> A few options:
> 
> Keep the current behavior
> Remove conversion process
> Use an option (e.g. res.text({ convert: true }))
> Make a new method (e.g. res.textConverted())
> I'm leaning towards 4. 1 makes this module incompatible with the browser (something I don't want to do), 2 makes transition to v2 more difficult for people already using this library, and I'm reluctant to modify the behaviors of a well-defined function such as .text().
> 
> Thoughts?
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

OK I just checked, it's not worth going through this:

https://github.com/whatwg/fetch/issues/353#issuecomment-237476765

I support option 4.

issue.title: Add a new res.textConverted() and always use UTF-8 for res.text()

repository.name: node-fetch
repository.description: A light-weight module that brings the Fetch API to Node.js

issue.body:
Also uses iconv-lite directly instead of using the "encoding" package.

Fixes #184.
